alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:22PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall has occurred. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following counties, Carbon, Stillwater and Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Debris and water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM MDT, Emergency Management has reported some minor flooding has occurred in the area with debris still on some rural roads. Other small creeks and streams may still be experiencing some minor flooding. - Precipitation has ended across the area and water levels should continue to recede through the day. Motorists should continue to heed road closures. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding issues include... Absarokee, Dean, Fishtail, Nye, Roscoe, Reed Point, Greycliff, Luther, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Fox, Roberts and Mc Leod. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be sure to heed all road closure signs.
